intro: Chrysodracon auwahiensis, commonly known as the Auwahi endemic chrysodracon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the native forests of Hawaii. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered critically endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique species.
